doc.previous: Until the Cardwell Reforms in 1871 commissions in the British Army were purchased by officers The Royal Navy however operated on a more meritocratic or at least socially mobile basis
doc.after: Most officers in the Armed Forces of the United States are typically commissioned through one of three major commissioning programs
